Bunker blows, we move in fast on the other two, just like we trained it. Questions? All right, lets-- Tex raises his hand.
Sir... I'd like Doss to pray for us before we go up. Glover is stunned, but no more surprised then Desmond.
“Pray for us?”  3.4.13 70.
The Company.
You gotta problem with that, Doss?
(uncomfortable) No, sir.
Well - I guess it can’t hurt.

Beneath the overhang, every man in Company B has assemble for the assault. Above them, Army mortars are continuousl blasting the top of the ridge. Titles: Second Assault on Hacksaw Ridge. Glover gestures unenthusiastically to Desmond who removes helmet and kneels, as do Tex and some of the other men. Smitty hangs back but he watches everything closely. Desmond himself is nervous; this is not something he want do, or is comfortable with.

Lord. We pray - that you give our officers here, especially Captain Glover, wisdom in knowing how to give his orders because our lives are in his charge. Give us wisdom and the...the help we need in taking all the precautions we can, and if it be Your Will, we all come back alive. Amen. Desmond looks around. To his surprise, all the men seem focused in their prayers. Several of them echo his “Amen” with unusual conviction. Glover looks around at his Compa and nods. For better or worse - it’s time.
OK. Let's go. The men of Company B begin rapidly climbing up the cargo and scale the cliff. Reaching...  3.4.13 71.

Careful to stay below the berm, they crawl on their hands knees and spread out along the edge of the cliff in good order. Desmond watches as Captain Glover quietly signals over th radio to the mortar teams below. Almost immediately, the Mortar barrage stops. That’s the signal for Company B to attack. As one, the me throw grenades over the berm and then rise up and begin a concentrated FIRE across the plateau. Smitty focuses his BAR on the MAIN BUNKER while... The DEMO MAN crawls out onto the plateau, beneath the bul of his own men, carrying a twenty pound satchel charge of dynamite. When he is within ten feet of the Main Bunker, pulls the fuse and throws his satchel on top of the bunke There is a tremendous EXPLOSION, blowing a hole in the Bu roof. As the men are waiting for the dust to clear-- A SNIPER SHOT hits Schecter in the leg. He yells once and falls. Immediately, Desmond kneels beside him.
Oh, man, that hurts! How bad? Desmond looks down at Irv’s leg and sees a severe, but survivable entrance wound. The exit wound, however, is mu worse.
Million dollar wound, Irv. You're going home. Desmond starts to give Schecter a morphine injection.

No--No morphine. I’m good! Save it for somebody who needs it. Desmond hesitates a moment, considering how tightly to wr the tourniquet. He glances at the wound once more and wra a loose tourniquet around Schecter’s leg as a Stretcher T hurries up alongside. They pick up Schecter and carry him off; Schecter gives Desmond the thumbs up as he goes.  3.4.13 72. Glover gestures and then leads a charge of the entire Company, yelling and screaming... Desmond hurries after h Company as they race--

...towards the now vulnerable bunker. Several men toss grenades into the hole. Within the bunke explosions shudder the ground in rapid succession. SCREAM echo up from inside. A soldier releases a searing blast of LIQUID FIRE from hi flame-thrower into the Bunker’s gun port and the screams inside intensify. Having demolished the Main Bunker, the Company splits int TWO PRE-ASSIGNED TEAMS and each team attacks one of the t remaining bunkers with grenades, satchel charges, and flamethrowers. The Company sweeps the Ridge - victorious.
Desmond climbs down the cargo net to find a group of his fellow soldiers waiting for him. The men smile at him and pat and touch his shoulder affectionately.
Heya, Doss!/Thanks, buddy!/ Way to pray./Bless you, man./You saved us! Desmond smiles tightly and nods--uncomfortable with their praise.
The usual chaos as overworked doctors and nurses tend to newly wounded. Desmond glances around and grabs a passing surgeon.

What happened to Schecter--medic in company B? He came in just as we started the assault. The Surgeon looks at Desmond and shakes his head. DESMOND (cont'd) (stunned) He wasn’t hurt that bad!  3.4.13 73.
The tourniquet must’ve come loose, he was bleeding profusely, went into shock. At least you gave him morphine. Desmond's face drains.
He didn’t want any. The surgeon moves on, hurried. Desmond is devastated, gui ridden for letting his friend die in pain.
Captain Glover is on the radio with his superior officer, Lt. Colonel Cooney, at First Battalion HQ.
Company B accomplished its objective today and we have secured a foothold on the plateau.

INT. FIRST BATTALION HQ - LT. COONEY’S TENT - EVENING LT. COONEY, an overweight but powerful man sits uncomfort in his tent, a map engulfing the table in front of him. A he hears this news, he relaxes slightly.
(surprised) Well done, Captain. Casualties?
Just one, sir.
Repeat please.
We had one casualty, sir.
Company A on your left was decimated and you had only one casualty? Are you sure you attacked the right ridge?  3.4.13
Yes, sir.
Well, what the heck did you boys do differently out there today?
Desmond and Smitty are carefully heating a cup of coffee the flame of their burning K-ration wrappers. Smitty is starting to relax around Desmond.
So what’s next? I’ve got a canteen of water here you could turn to wine if you want.
It wasn’t me; I didn’t do anything.
Yeah. It was God or whatever, but you prayed him down.
He’s not a-- a faucet you turn off and on. He doesn’t come running when I whistle, it doesn’t work that way.
You know what? You’re a real pain in the ass! You’re all Holy Joe when we're stomping you but then when we’re on your side that doesn’t make you feel good either!
(very quietly) Irv died.
Schecter? What happened?
I screwed up.  3.4.13 75.

Engineers are cutting SHEETS OF TIN with metal snips and bending them around empty artillery shells to make long U SHAPED SECTIONS. Other Engineers connect the sections int six-foot-long units using a hand punch and metal brads fo fasteners. There’s something medieval about the image, li blacksmiths preparing strange Gothic siege equipment.
Captain Glover’s primitive map diagram reflects the day’s success and tomorrow’s objective.

Every man should take pride in what we did today. Company B achieved something that no other unit in the 381st or the 307th has managed in the last four weeks. There are murmurs of satisfaction among the men. Some whistle quietly, or nudge each other in approval. Only Desmond is quiet. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) It looks like we broke the back of Hacksaw’s defensive line. However, Chief noticed a cave opening hidden behind those three pillboxes. There’s some speculation that this may lead to the heart of the Japanese fortifications.
It’s too big for satchel charges.

Exactly. So I’ve got Engineering building us a metal trough we can carry up in sections and assemble on top. I figure we poke the end of the trough into that cave and pour a dozen Jerry cans of gasoline and diesel fuel down their throats-- and then throw in a phosphorus grenade or two.
Fry the sumbitches. The men nod, spoiling for revenge.  3.4.13 76.

Any luck, we'll be done with Hacksaw Ridge by tomorrow afternoon and headed to the coast. EXT. THE PLATEAU - DESMOND & SMITTY’S FOXHOLE - NIGHT Both men are crouched in their foxhole, waiting for first light. Desmond whispers...
You hear something? Smitty shakes his head but he lifts his gun. Both men lea forward but the darkness is impenetrable.

May be just a rat. There is another SOUND now, clear to both men, off to the left. Smitty slides a round into the chamber of his rifle Suddenly, they are swarmed by JAPANESE SOLDIERS! Smitty shoots one but the second soldier bayonets him in the gut Desmond ducks a savage thrust from a third soldier and clobbers him in the side of the head with his metal helme Desmond tries to get to Smitty but another soldier steps between them and fires his gun so close that the heat of blast scorches the side of Desmond's face. Desmond grabs barrel and pulls the Jap soldier forward, swinging his el wildly into the man’s face and shattering his nose. Desmond gets hit in the back and knocked to the ground. H fingers search blindly for any kind of weapon and he find broken rifle in the mud. He staggers to his feet, swingin the rifle like a bat but a JAPANESE OFFICER steps forward pistol extended, pointed at Desmond’s heart. Without thinking, Desmond raises his rifle but a FLARE go off overhead, bathing the battlefield in a eerie green li and in that split-second Desmond realizes that the Japane Officer looks weirdly familiar... He looks like - no, he is - Desmond’s Father! Tom Doss sm at Desmond as he pulls the trigger and the bullet tears i Desmond’s chest and...

Desmond wakes up in a cold sweat; his heart pounding. He back in his foxhole on top of the Ridge at night. Smitty sits across from him, smoking a cigarette and carefully cupping the burning ember so as not to give away their position. Desmond breathes deeply. Shudders.

Hell of a dream. Desmond nods. Drinks some water from his canteen. Rubs hi stiff neck. Smitty’s rifle is propped up within easy reac and Desmond finds he can’t take his eyes off it. Smitty notices; picks the rifle up. SMITTY (cont'd) It won’t bite, you know.

Yes, it will. Desmond takes a breath. DESMOND (cont'd) My dad was a drunk. He fought it for years but it got ahold of him hard. Made him mean. Desmond pauses. And Smitty knows he’s hearing a raw story
How mean?
He use to beat me and my brother just because the sun rose and about as often. I could take that. But when he laid his hand on my momma...

Bertha sits on the front step, SOBBING, one hand to her bloodied face. Eight year old Desmond huddles beside her, protectively, one arm around her shoulder. In the yard, Tom argues violently with Bertha’s brother, UNCLE ARTHUR. Both men are drunk and angry.  3.4.13 78.
Get your damn nose out of my business! You hear me?
Touch my sister again, and see what happens.

Tom swings at Arthur, catching him off-guard, but Arthur comes roaring back with a flurry of punches which drive T stumbling backwards. Tom trips and falls. Arthur kicks at him but Tom grabs Arthur’s foot and bring the bigger man down. They roll over and over across the yard, punching and gouging. Tom staggers to his feet and pulls a PISTOL out of his ja pocket! Bertha leaps up.
TOM! DON’T! With no thought for her own safety, Bertha throws herself between the two men. Desmond watches from the porch, an eight-year-old boy, fr with fear.
Momma ! Tom’s hand is shaking but he continues to hold the gun ou front of him - now pointed directly at Bertha. She moves towards Tom, her eyes never leaving his face.

Give me that gun, Tom. Please. Give it here, before somebody gets hurt. Tom hesitates. In the distance, there is the SOUND of an approaching Police Siren. BERTHA (cont'd) You kill him, and they’1l hang you for sure. You know they will. Tom’s courage deserts him and he hands the gun over to Bertha.  3.4.13 79. BERTHA (cont'd) Desmond! You take this and get rid of it somewhere. Throw it in the river! Desmond runs over and takes the gun from Bertha. BERTHA (cont'd) Go on, now! Hurry before the police get here! Desmond takes off running.
You throw it away? This is very hard for Desmond; he’s never told anybody th before. Ever.
That’s what I told my momma.
What’d you really do?
Hid it. In the woods.
How come?

Desmond returns back to the house just as the POLICE load handcuffed father into a police car in front of gawking neighbors. Bertha is weeping, hugging Tom, but he ignores her. Over shoulder, Tom can see Desmond, watching his father’s publ shame - and he glares maliciously at his son.
Because I was going to need it to kill my daddy.
Bertha stands outside the bathroom door. From inside, the are the SOUNDS of sharp blows.  3.4.13 80.
Tom! Please. Stop it!
Inside the bathroom, Tom brutally whips Desmond with his razor strop.
Tom, you’re gonna kill the boy!
Desmond grits his teeth - he won’t give his father the satisfaction of crying out - but he can’t stop the tears are running down his face.

Finally released, Desmond runs through the woods, the tea drying on his fierce face, his eyes blazing. He reaches an old gnarled Oak Tree and falls to his knees He digs inside a hollow in the roots and extracts a weath cigar box and reaches inside to pull out - his father’s g Desmond examines the gun in the fading light. The weight it feels good in his hands. The intricacies of the mechan itself are appealing. And in its power to distribute Justice, in its God-like power of life and death - it is beautiful thing.

Desmond enters his house and moves up the stairs. He stop on the landing. From his parents’ room he can hear their voices. Desmond pushes open the door to... INT. DOSS HOUSE - PARENTS’ BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS His mother sits at her vanity table, brushing her hair. T paces back and forth behind Bertha, berating her.
Spare the rod and spoil the child! Isn’t that what that church of yours preaches?! Well that boy’s spoiled rotten and it’s about time-- He stops when Desmond enters.  3.4.13 81.
What do you want? Desmond raises the gun. Tom’s eyes widen in fear. The gun wavers in Desmond’s trembling hand.
Smitty leans forward in disbelief.
You killed him? INT. DOSS HOUSE - PARENTS’ BEDROOM - EVENING - THE PAST Desmond stands there pointing the gun at his father while mother looks on in horror.
I could’ve. God knows I wanted to. I wanted to kill him for everything he ever did my momma, and my brother, and to me! Then, although it takes everything Desmond has, he turns around and walks away.
Desmond stares at the dark waters rolling past. He throws the gun into the river as far as he can.
But I didn’t. And that’s when I made a promise to God I’d never touch a gun again.
It isn’t because I’m more holy than the next guy. It isn’t because I I’m any better. Just the opposite.  3.4.13 82.

(quietly) You think--looking at all the killing everywhere around us--you really think there’s a God that gives a damn about us? Desmond looks at him. Smitty is serious. Desmond nods. SMITTY (cont'd) That'd really be something if it was true. Wouldn’t it? A Japanese mortar round lands ten yards away, scattering debris and shrapnel over both men. As other mortar shells begin to fall, a JAPANESE HAND GRENADE lands close to the Smitty pushes Desmond down, grabs his B.A.R. and begins spraying the field in front of them. Simultaneously, JAPA SOLDIERS appear out of hidden spider holes and trenches n only in front of, but within the American lines. It’s as they materialized out of the mud by magic. A chaotic fire-fight breaks out all around Desmond and Sm as the terrified American soldiers of Company B discover the enemy is all around them. Cross fire from both sides kills indiscriminately. A Japanese Soldier bursts out of the darkness behind Smit and bayonets him in the back. Smitty screams. Desmond jum up and punches the Japanese soldier in the face, knocking to the ground. The Japanese soldier pulls out a knife and Desmond launch himself on top of the man, trying to wrestle the knife aw The two roll over and over across the muddy ground. Desmo manages to break the other man’s grip on the knife but th soldier grabs Desmond by the throat and begins choking hi Desmond is close to blacking out. He reaches out desperately, trying to find something, anything. His hand touch a ROCK and he manages a glancing blow on the should of the Japanese soldier. It’s enough to break his hold on Desmond’s throat. Desmond pushes the soldier away and rol over on top of him. Desmond raises the rock above his head in both hands, prepared to bring it down on his enemy’s skull in a crush blow. He screams as he begins to bring the rock down but knocked off course by a nearby explosion. Desmond is momentarily stunned but almost immediately pic up the rock again and turns back to the Japanese soldier.  3.4.13 83. He is weeping with fury and frustration. In that one brie moment, the Japanese Soldier rolls away narrowly escaping Desmond's blow, staggers to his feet and runs off. Desmond crawls over to Smitty but he’s too late. Smitty i dead. Desmond is utterly distraught.

The entire area is engulfed in flame and weapons fire. Al over the killing field, individual fights and deaths are playing out as the sun begins to peek over the horizon, casting a dull red glow over ground running with blood. Among it all, we find Captain Glover and his RADIO OPERAT Glover tries to assert command and save what’s left of hi rapidly collapsing company.

Glover throws a smoke grenade to try and mask his troops’ withdrawal to the cliff’s edge. His men fire frantically an enemy who seems to be everywhere, sometimes hitting th own men. Glover yells at his RADIO OPERATOR. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d)

As the Radio Operator picks up his headset, a Japanese Sn bullet catches him squarely in the forehead. A Second American Soldier grabs the headset and is also h Glover reaches for the headset and a burst of machine gun fire destroys the equipment and sprays shrapnel in his fa and chest. Desmond grabs Smitty’s body by the collar of his shirt an drags him back towards the safety of the cliff, some fift yards away.

Despite the horror and chaos, those American Soldiers who make it back to the cliff try to set up a perimeter behin the berm and return fire so that the rest of their comrad can get off of Hacksaw.  3.4.13 84. As Desmond approaches the cliff edge, Grease frantically waves him to drop down.

Get down! DOWN! Desmond glances over his shoulder to see THREE JAPANESE SOLDIERS, bayonets fixed on their rifles, racing towards Desmond sprawls on the ground and Grease fires, killing t of the Japanese and wounding the Third Soldier - who stag past Desmond and STABS Grease in the gut. Grease drops his rifle and SCREAMS. He wraps his arms aro his assailant and frantic, staggers backwards and falls.. .»..over the edge of the cliff, screaming horribly all th down. Desmond drags Smitty’s body to the edge of the cliff wher insane scramble of men are trying to get down the cargo n ropes, and ladders. Soldiers drop or throw their weapons away. Some, desperate to the point of madness, JUMP OFF t cliff. A burst of MACHINE GUN fire kills Rennelli, not five feet from Desmond. Desmond is swept up in the confusion and terror; men are falling so fast he doesn’t know where to turn. He looks D THE CARGO NET--offerring him escape... Desmond glances back toward the retreating Americans. Any man who can still move on his own is running or crawling to the cliff. Behind them, everywhere, there are dead, dying, and wounded American soldiers littering the platea Desmond is covered in sweat, mud, and blood. Shaking with fear and adrenalin. Escape is just a few feet away but - this is what he is here for. He takes a deep, shuddering breath and... .+..Desmond heads back, onto the killing field, passing Captain Glover and the last of the rear guard as he does

Desmond finds a Soldier with a sucking chest wound. Desmo peels away the man’s bloody uniform blouse and applies a battle dressing but the strength of the panicked soldier' desperate gasps for air threaten to pull the dressing fur into the wound.  3.4.13 85. Thinking quickly, Desmond pulls out his poncho and rips o square of plastic from the tail. Desmond puts the plastic patch over the wound to seal it, and then finishes it off with the bandage. It holds. Desmond grabs the Soldier by the collar of his shirt and drags him back to...

What remains of Company B’s makeshift Rear Guard is throw grenades as fast as they can out of open crates hand-carr to the top. Two STRETCHER BEARERS grab Desmond’s wounded soldier and start down the cargo net with him. To their surprise, Desmond doesn’t follow.
COME ON! WE’VE BEEN ORDERED OFF!
Desmond shakes his head--no.

Stretcher Bearer#1 looks at Stretcher Bearer#2. The two men tear off their first aid field packs and quic disappear over the edge. Desmond grabs their kits and hea back on his hands and knees onto the field of fire.

The sun is at a low angle now, throwing long shadows acro the top of the plateau which is clouded with smoke and du creating a surreal world of shadows in which it is imposs to determine friend from foe until you are almost on them Desmond manages to creep from spot to spot, relatively unseen. Japanese Mortar Fire still falls erratically, along with individual sniping. Desmond finds another Soldier moaning the ground, his right arm mangled. Desmond applies a tourniquet and starts to drag the man back. As he passes another Wounded Soldier, the man cries out and tries to clutch his sleeve.
Don’t leave me!  3.4.13 86. Desmond hesitates. Then...
I’m comin’ back.
In the relative safety of the base of the cliff, Glover, face and chest still covered in blood, tries to get a han on his situation.
How many we got down?!?
Must’a left nearly seventy-five men up there! Glover shakes his head. This is a disaster.

Desmond drags the wounded Soldier back to the lip. He loo over the edge. If he climbs down with each casualty it wi take twice as long, he’ll exhaust himself quickly, and ot men will die who might have been saved. Making a quick decision, Desmond grabs one of the ropes hanging over the cliff edge and pulls it up. He doubles t rope and ties a bowline in it - just like he did that day basic training--a secure knot with TWO LOOPS. Desmond secures the wounded man’s legs, one into each loo wraps the remaining rope around the man’s chest twice and then, bracing himself against a rock, slowly lowers the m down to...

...where the two stretcher bearers are huddled on the gro in exhaustion, sucking down water. To their astonishment, they glance up to see the wounded soldier being lowered towards them. They spring into action, catching the wounded soldier by legs and gently laying him down on the ground.
The two men hurriedly unhook the wounded soldier and the disappears back up the cliff. Two additional Stretcher Bearers come running up with a litter. Behind them is Captain Glover.
What the hell is going on!?!?
Some nut up there is dragging wounded off the top.
It’s that medic--Doss. Glover glances up through the smoke and the dust...to see another casualty being lowered down. Just for a moment he glimpses Desmond’s face over the edge of the cliff.

Doss?! What are you doing?! Get your ass down from there! Desmond ignores him and disappears back over the edge. Glover looks around, trying to figure out how to play thi He gestures to a Second Radio Operator. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d)

head_text.subj: DON'T JUST STAND THERE. CALL THE

text: Desmond spots THREE WOUNDED AMERICAN SOLDIERS lying in th lee of a small group of rocks which are barely keeping th alive, covered as they are by overlapping lines of fire f multiple Japanese positions. Desmond crawls towards the soldiers, trying to use a shal depression in the terrain to get close, but a BURST of fi from a Japanese machine gun pins him down. Desmond tries to catch his breath, wipe the sweat out of eyes, and regain his courage. He moves again towards the soldiers, and again a burst of machine gun explodes around him, even closer now, shatter the tip of the stones which barely cover him, and cutting with razor-sharp shards of shattered limestone.  3.4.13 88. Desmond is momentarily paralyzed with fear. He knows if h waits any longer, he will lose what little courage he has left. He carefully reaches behind and yanks out his tatte poncho. Desmond rolls over on his back and waves his poncho over top of the rocks, drawing a characteristic 6-8 round burs fire from the Jap machine gun. Then he hears it stop-- THE JAPANESE MACHINE GUNNERS must stop firing and reload. As they reload, Desmond jumps to his feet and sprints aro the side of the rocks, grabs one of the wounded soldiers, drags him quickly towards the cliff’s edge.

A new wave of wounded soldiers are suddenly being carried by stretcher teams. As the HEAD DOCTOR begins his examination of the first man - the soldier with the sucki chest wound - he glances over at the stretcher team who brought him in.
Where these guys coming from?
There’s a medic still on top.
On Hacksaw?
Won’t come down. The Head Doctor and his Nurse look at one another in disbelief.

Desmond crawls on his hands and knees to a new position behind a small limestone outcropping. Sprawled on the gro beside him are the bodies of four dead Japanese soldiers, killed by a mortar blast. Desmond is only fifteen yards away from the remaining two wounded American soldiers but they are still closely cove by two Japanese machine guns.  3.4.13 89.

A member of one of the machine gun units spots Desmond an excitedly waves to his partner who rachets back the retur his weapon and sprays Desmond's position with a quick bur Desmond hugs the ground with everything he has. The bulle whistle over his head, inches away.

Simultaneously, from inside one of the Japanese undergrou firing positions hand carved out of the limestone, a JAPA SNIPER also glimpses Desmond. He carefully slides into position, his rifle poking out of a six inch wide gun por The magnified cross-hairs of his sniper scope slide over rocks until they settle on Desmond's head. Desmond ducks down. The sniper takes a breath. Only a matter of time before Desmond raises his head again.

Desmond, still focused on the machine gun position (and oblivious to the sniper now stalking him) racks his brain trying to think of a way to get to the two wounded men. He glances at one of the dead Japanese soldiers beside hi and an idea forms. Desmond takes off his helmet and rips the tape hiding the Red Cross symbol. He straps his helme on the dead Japanese Soldier and then very carefully push the dead man forward so that his head and trunk appear ab the rock outcropping. A single shot rings out - the sniper strikes Desmond’s he dead center. Desmond hadn’t expected that - the sniper - he has the presence of mind to fling the dead soldier out from behind the rocks, to the side away from his American wounded. Both Jap machine gun emplacements rake the corps Simultaneously, Desmond rolls out the other side, rises t his feet and sprints like crazy while the machine gun tea reload. Desmond swoops down, grabs the second American soldier by the collar, and drags him off.  3.4.13 90.

The SNIPER realizes he’s been tricked but by the time he put another round into the chamber and get his sights on Desmond, the American has disappeared. The Sniper curses blue streak in Japanese, and then moves to find a better vantage point. The Sniper half runs, half crawls, through a SERIES OF TUNNELS until he reaches...
A dead Japanese Soldier lies slumped against the port. Th Sniper shoves him to the floor and takes his place, rifle the ready...
Desmond moves as fast as he can, darting from rock to roc dragging his wounded soldier behind him. He’s only ten ya away from the edge of the cliff.

The Sniper smiles as Desmond comes right into his sights. slowly squeezes the trigger and - the gun jams! Furious, works the rifle bolt to eject the offending shell but whe peeks again through the hole...Desmond is gone again.

What’s left of Company B has fallen back to a position of relative safety behind the Command Post. The men are ina state of shock. Some, like Tex and Hollywood, just sit an stare into space, lit cigarettes dangling uselessly from their trembling fingers. Others weep shamelessly. Chief r up and crouches down beside Tex and Hollywood.
(quietly) Desmond is still up there.
Doss? Hollwood’s ears perk up.
Wait. On Hacksaw?  3.4.13 91. Chief nods. The three men look at one another. They rise stiffly to their feet and head back towards Hacksaw Ridge

Desmond has returned to get the third soldier. He's deliberately approached him from yet another direction bu even from here, the wounded man is still well covered by two Japanese machine gun emplacements. Desmond inches his way through a field of American and Japanese corpses when one of the Japanese dead moans. Desmond stops and glances over at the Japanese soldier. T man has been shot in the shoulder but he’s not bleeding badly. Left alone, he will surely die but if bandaged, he might survive. Desmond hesitates - then begins to crawl a towards his intended goal, the wounded American. The Japanese soldier moans again. Desmond stops. He can’t let him die. Desmond moves back alongside the Japanese soldier and begins to dress his shoulder wound.

The Japanese Sniper moves from one shooting port to the n searching for Desmond. He stops. Smiles. He puts his gun up to the port and wipes the sweat off his face and then screws his eye to the sniper scope.

The cross-hairs move across the landscape...and find Desm The cross-hairs start up toward Desmond’s forehead, but something he glimpsed confuses the sniper; he moves the crosshairs down to the wounded soldier Desmond is tending and his Japanese insignia comes into clear focus. The sniper recoils in astonishment. For a moment, he is bewildered. He puts his eye back to the scope.

Desmond wipes the Japanese soldier’s bullet wound with alcohol and sprinkles sulfa powder over it; he knows he’s exposed here and he’s working as quickly as he can. Every second could be his last.  3.4.13 92.

The sniper lifts his eye from the scope again; what Desmo is doing has caused him to scan across the whole field of ruptured bodies, both Japanese and American. But he’s a soldier, and whispers to himself--
(in Japanese) What are you waiting for?! He takes a breath, lowers his eye to his scope, and takes careful aim.

--He lines the cross-hairs up on Desmond's head. --Close on sniper’s finger curling slowly around the trig --Close on sniper’s mouth as he gently exhales --He squeezes the trigger. --Through the scope, he sees Desmond taping the final ban in place when a mortar shell lands between Desmond and th Sniper! The debris shatters the Sniper’s scope and blinds him. He staggers back from the port, blood pouring down his face. Another mortar shell lands even closer and the tunnel sha The Sniper turns to run and a third mortar shell falls directly on his position and as he screams, the tunnel disintegrates around him, burying him alive.

Desmond is oblivious to the fate of the sniper as mortar shells are now falling thick and fast all over the platea Knowing that any Japanese in the area are as much at risk from these random rounds as he is, Desmond makes a calcul decision to go for it. He rises to his feet and sprints t the third wounded American. Desmond reaches him and pulls him up to his feet, drapes man’s left arm around his own neck, and begins to stagger towards the ridge.  3.4.13 93.

Desmond has roped up the third man and just lowered him d to safety. Desmond crouches there on his hands and knees, shaking with exhaustion. Behind him, in the distance, he hears another American vo calling for help. Desmond closes his eyes.
(quietly) Just one more. Please.

A SERIES OF SHOTS as the sun moves overhead across the sk and Desmond moves across the plateau, saving one life at time, dragging/carrying each soldier to the edge of the cliff, roping him up and lowering him down to safety.
Let me get one more...

Glover, Hollywood, Chief, Tex and dozens of soldiers from other companies watch silently as Desmond lowers one last down from Hacksaw Ridge...but this one is already dead... We see this last man’s face...it’s Smitty. As the body slowly descends, we realize Desmond’s last act was to retrieve Smitty’s body. And with that, Desmond finally leaves Hacksaw Ridge. Slow painfully, he climbs down the rope alone. When Desmond reaches the bottom, he fights not to collaps into the arms of the men waiting at the base of the cliff His uniform is completely soaked with blood and mud, and flies swarm around him but he’s too tired to bat them awa with his torn and bleeding hands. The men stare at him li he’s a ghost as Desmond glances down at his uniform, straining to move his head to look up again. Captain Glover is one of them.
Is he wounded?
He’s not shot.
(barely audible) Sorry.
For what?
I think...
They’re all down, Desmond. You got’em all. (to the others) Go him to the aid station.

Everyone has heard about Desmond’s heroics. The surgeons, stretcher teams, and nurses all watch silently as Desmond changes his bloody uniform for a replacement uniform - a washed and bleached uniform of a dead soldier. Carefully, he removes his pocket Bible, taking a moment t try and wipe off the blood that stains its front cover. Something on the blouse he’s about to put on catches his The lettering is faded but it looks like..."Schecter."” For just a moment, everything swims in front of his eyes. EXT. DESMOND’S FOXHOLE, BELOW THE RIDGE - NIGHT Raining. Along with the usual sporadic Japanese mortar fi Desmond sits - alone - in the dugout he once shared with Smitty. Tex scurries up out of the dark. He puts a can of rations down in front of Desmond.
What’s this? JOSH “TEX” ROYAL (quietly) Peaches. Never liked’em all that much. Tex leaves. A moment later, Hollywood comes over and sets down another rare can of non-meat K rations.  3.4.13 95.
Here. I’m full. From all over, Company B survivors come up to Desmond, on one, and silently lay cans of non-meat food in front of h and then disappear into the dark. Desmond stares at the p of food.
It is a very subdued meeting of a much reduced leadership team. The men are exhausted; completely worn out mentally and physically.

(barely audible) Okay. (louder) Okay. Word is...word from HQ is, we gotta go back up on Hacksaw tomorrow. And we gotta take it, this time. The men are silent, close to mutiny. In the rear, someone groans. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) I know, I know. Look, they know what we're up against and they’ve promised us a full company of reinforcements, and a massive bombardment preceding the assault, including naval guns and aircraft. The heart of their defensive line is that cave towards the rear of the escarpment. We get to that, take out that cave, and Hacksaw is ours. The men look at one another, reaching some unspoken agreement, and then stare back to Sergeant Jones.
Sir? The only way Company B goes back up on that Ridge tomorrow is if Desmond Doss goes with us.
(confused) Any reason to think he won't?  3.4.13 96.
Well - it’s Saturday.

Desmond sits behind the shelter of a stone Okinawan tomb, reading his Bible when to his surprise Captain Glover appears. Glover squats down beside Desmond; looks out ove the countryside as the first sliver of sunlight illuminat the landscape.

Sometimes, if I squint a little bit, this countryside reminds me a little bit of South Carolina. A South Carolina that’s been bombed and blown to a jillion little muddy pieces but still... Desmond nods.
You catch a whiff of pine sometimes, almost makes me homesick.

We’re gonna have to go back up on Hacksaw tomorrow. And tomorrow is your Sabbath. (beat) Most of the men don’t believe in the same way you do. But they believe so much... in how much you believe... that they won’t go up that Ridge unless you’re with them, completely. Desmond looks back at the Captain, not sure he understand what Glover is asking. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) It’s not their Sabbath, it’s yours. And they figure that for this assault to be square with God, it’s gotta be square with you. Desmond puts down his Bible and studies Glover.
Sir, if you could give me...just a few minutes.  3.4.13 97.

Explosion after explosion tears into the Ridge from a var of American guns: mortars, howitzers, off-shore Naval batteries and Army rockets. Marine F4U Corsairs bomb and strafe the rugged terrain. Occasionally, a secondary explosion indicates some lucky round has found its mark - ammunition or fuel dump. Titles: Hacksaw Ridge. Third Assault. Smoke, dust, and debris rise into the air in a dark cloud with flame as if the Ridge were an erupting volcano.

The men of Company B - resigned veterans and nervous replacements - wait in their pre-assault positions. But their focus is not on the Ridge. They are all looking backwards, toward the rear of the line.
Glover smokes a last cigarette while he gets an earful fr HQ over the Company field telephone.
INT. FIRST BATTALION HQ - LT. COONEY’S OFFICE - DAY
What the hell is your delay, Captain?! You were supposed to begin that assault ten minutes ago! The entire 307th Infantry and the whole 7th Fleet is cooling its heels for you!
We're waiting, sir.
Waiting for what?! Captain Glover glances towards the rear of the line where the distance, a long figure kneels.
We're waiting for Private Doss to finish praying.  3.4.13 98.
On his knees, Dorothy’s Bible in his hands. The strain an horror of the last ten days is etched in his face. Haltingly, Desmond tries to work this out with his God.

(quietly) I’ve done my best to...to be faithful to you, and the promises I made. I gotta...break one of those promises now and I’m asking your forgiveness. It may be a wrong thing but I can’t let my men go up there alone. And if that is a sin then I take it on my heart, alone. Amen. Chief nudges Hollywood and points to where Desmond Doss i walking towards them.
Captain Glover sees Desmond coming, rejoining the line.
(into field telephone) Company B is ready to go, sir.

Above them, the bombardment suddenly stops. The SILENCE i deafening. Every man left in Company B - including Desmon is ready. On their faces, each and every one, is a fierce look of quiet determination. Captain Glover looks to Desmond. Desmond nods.
(quietly) Let's go. Glover leads his men climbing up the cargo nets. Desmond follows behind.

head_text.subj: BELOW THE LIP OF THE PLATEAU

text: Glover and his group leaders hang for a moment on the car nets as they pull grenades out of their pockets. They yan the pins and lob the grenades over their heads onto the plateau.  3.4.13 99. As soon as the grenades begin exploding, Glover and the m are climbing as fast as they can.
Glover leads his men in a wild charge up and over the edg the cliff and onto....

The men of Company B quickly sweep past the stunned Japan positions and overwhelm the few defenders unlucky enough be caught above ground. The Americans push on towards the southern edge of the plateau and...

The ASSAULT TEAMS move with grim efficiency. Riflemen thr smoke grenades, shielding their work from the Japanese mo squads on the southern hills. BAR Squads keep the defenders pinned down within the cave complex entrance... EXPLOSIVE TEAMS inch forward under fire to throw their satchel charges inside. As soon as the explosions erupt, Glover sends in the FLAM THROWER TEAMS who douse the opening with long searing plu of fire. Following them, Chief, Tex, and Hollywood run up with ope JERRY CANS OF GASOLINE, one after another, which they thr into the mouth of the cave and the shaft below. Glover edges close to the entrance and throws in two phosphorus grenades igniting an ENORMOUS EXPLOSION that c only mean that somewhere inside, a major ammo dump has ca fire. Suddenly, the entire ridge SHAKES like an earthquake. SMOKE billows out, not just through the cave entrance but through dozens and dozens of different SNIPER HOLES and cunningly hidden ASSAULT ENTRANCES scattered all over. Tasting blood, Company B sweeps past the Big Cave entranc SCREAMING with battle lust and moves down...  3.4.13 100.
A tide of lethal efficiency sweeping everything before it Hacksaw Ridge is finally falling.

Desmond follows Tex, Chief, and Hollywood as they continu secure the southern flank of the Ridge. Suddenly, to their left, a JAPANESE SOLDIER rises from hi spider hole, pistol in one hand and grenade in the other. empties his pistol wildly but all three men get rounds of reply, dropping the Japanese Soldier to his knees with sh to the chest and head but... ...-As he collapses, he throws the HAND GRENADE. The hand grenade comes arcing towards the Americans. Desmond PUSHES his fellow soldiers out of the way but the no escape for himself. The grenade lands directly in front of Desmond. He throws himself backwards and simultaneously tries to kick the grenade away... The grenade EXPLODES with a shower of dirt, rocks, and bl Desmond SCREAMS with pain. He looks down at his leg - it’ ragged and covered with blood. Desmond rolls over onto hi back.

Bright arterial blood is beginning to spurt from Desmond' torn femoral artery. Chief squats down beside him and pla both his big hands on the wound and presses down hard. Simultaneously, Tex is pulling battlefield dressings out Desmond’s kit with shaky hands and handing them to Chief.
Captain Glover comes running up and when he sees who the wounded man is, his face blanches.
Keep pressure on!
HE’S DYING!  3.4.13 101.
The hell he is! WE GOTTA GET HIM
The men gather around and pick up Desmond. [THE SAME SCEN

text: The men half run, half stumble across the still smoking battlefield, Desmond cradled in their arms, until they re the...
The men don’t hesitate. Carrying their wounded friend, th scramble down the nets and jury-rigged ladders, their constant attention only on Desmond...

Glover directs the men to carry Desmond to a waiting fiel ambulance. The TWO MEDICS there hastily load Desmond into the truck and begin prepping him for an IV. Glover leans over Desmond; Tex, Chief and Hollywood press close, anxiously. Desmond looks like hell. The color is completely drained of his face and he’s beginning to shake. Glover holds his hand. One of the Medics injects Desmond with morphine.
(quietly) You're going home, Desmond. See that pretty bride of yours. Desmond tries to talk. Can’t. Chokes. Shakily he pats his shirt pocket. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) What?
(almost inaudible) .-+-my bible.

You can get another copy when you get home. Hear it’s a popular book. Desmond tries to speak and coughs again, a violent shudde cough, and a bright clot of blood appears in the corner o his mouth. Glover glances over at one of the Medics...  3.4.13 102. ...the Medic shakes his head; this guy is not going to ma it. Glover clutches Desmond’s hand one more time. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) Hang in there, Desmond. Glover steps away as the ambulance drives off. Exhausted, Glover squats on the ground to steady himself. Around him, Tex, Chief, Hollywood, and the others collaps into the mud. Glover shakes his head; wipes the sweat and the mud out o his eyes; some decision slowly working its way out. He ri stiffly but with great determination, and begins re-armin himself from the stack of supplies and ammunition at the of the cliff. As it dawns on the men what Glover intends to do, Tex, Ch and Hollywood also rise and begin to arm themselves as we Glover glances at them. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) (quietly) You don’t have to... Every Jap still up there will die before he surrenders. The men nod. They all turn and look back up at the cliff. The plateau above is lit up again by artillery and mortar fire. Then, unbelievably, they begin to climb back up Hacksaw Ridge.

Desmond wakes. He tries to sit up but discovers his right arm and left leg are in a cast and the entire right side his body is covered with bandages. The pain and medicatio leave him feeling woozy and disoriented. He looks around.
A MAN in unbelievably filthy fatigues is standing beside bed, looking at him. Desmond manages to get his eyes to FOCUS and the man gradually swims into view - Captain Glo  3.4.13 103.

Doctors say you had enough shrapnel in you to build your own short wave radio. But you’re gonna be alright. Desmond manages a smile. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) Just so you know, I put you up for a sack of medals for what you did up on Hacksaw, so if some General with a chest-full of fruit salad comes through and pins one on you, you can blame me. Glover pauses and a smile creeps onto his face. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) Also, I have something of yours. Glover reaches into his jacket and retrieves Desmond’s be up, water stained POCKET BIBLE. CAPTAIN GLOVER (cont’d) When the men heard you were missing this, they all volunteered to go look for it. Kind of beat up but - they wanted you to know, they were thinking of you. Desmond takes the Bible and runs his hands over it. As Glover turns and walks away, Desmond notices a soldier (t soldier Desmond saved) sitting up in bed smiling with two stumps where his legs used to be. Desmond smiles back as the soldier lifts his water glass salutes Desmond.
Desmond, in his dress uniform, rides along a two-lane roa lost in thought.

Tom Doss stands out in the yard, clutching a liquor bottl conflicted. He brings the bottle up but instead of drinki from it, he tosses it as hard as he can.  3.4.13 104. Tom starts to turn away but then reconsiders. He walks toward where he threw the bottle, and as he reaches down pick it up, he notices the rock with Desmond’s note. He picks up the bottle and then the rock. As he stands readi the note, his eyes tear up. He turns the bottle upside do and pours it out. EXT. DOROTHY’S HOUSE - NIGHT A DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE CAR pulls up to Dorothy’s house, brakes squealing as it does. Fear freezes Dorothy immediately-- but it’s Desmond she sees limping out of th car. She runs to him and throws her arms around him. We s them both slowly kiss as the screen fades to black.

A beaming Harry Truman hangs the Medal of Honor around Desmond’s neck. TITLES (in separate cards): Desmond Doss was presented the Medal of Honor - the first conscientious objector to win America's highest award for courage under fire. Of his own heroics, he remained characteristically modest giving all the credit to his Faith and saying simply, “Th real heroes are buried over there.” He passed away at the age of 87 in March, 2006 and was bu in Arlington Cemetery. FADE TO BLACK. THE END.
